intro: Antistrophe oxyantha var. bhutanica, commonly known as the Bhutanese antistrophe, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan region. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and elliptical, glossy leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments at high altitudes. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its native range.
